alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 10:54PM PST until January 05 at 2:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by moderate to heavy rainfall. * WHERE...western San Luis Obispo County. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain still falling over western San Luis Obispo County. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Water is being reported on area roadways already and is expected to continue for the next several hours. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.40 inch per hour are being observed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Grover Beach, Santa Margarita, Templeton, Lake Lopez and Oceano. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
